After many years of experience in the trading field, she decided to open her own shop in 2007, where she sells clothes. She works independently and has gained a fair number of shop owners looking to buy her products. Today, she’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional clothes and other products for her business. She notes that this will help her develop her work and boost her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing factory.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes and other products for her business

loans.name: Oscar Andrey

texts.es: Oscar Andrey, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Oscar Andrey is twenty years old and single.  He lives with his parents and siblings, and they are his greatest priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for the labor to help with the coffee.  This way he will assure himself of doing a good job.

What he plans is to take advantage of the good weather conditions and the land that he has for this cultivation.  He will also put into practice the experience he has in growing coffee.  He will be able to buy the best products, better quality products, so that his crop develops well and is healthy.  He will then have an adequate production in the short term.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for assistance with the coffee.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 39-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband has been working at the airport since 1993. They are a united family, cooperating in order to enrich their way of life.

As for Siham, she has been selling Brazilian gold jewelry and accessories for the past nine years. Today she is requesting a 3,000,000 LBP loan from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional stocks of jewelry in order to boost her sales and earn a better income.

Siham’s plan is to open other branches as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of jewelry.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He’s a hard worker, depending on himself in order to collect money and build a good future. He opened his own minimarket in 2002 after being involved in this domain for many years. He knows very well how to select his products and serve his customers as much as he can. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional goods and provisions for his business in order to increase his sales and therefore his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and provisions for his business in order to increase his sales and therefore his profits

loans.name: Jean  Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 35 years old and married with four children aged between two and eleven years. He also takes care of seven relatives. For the past six years he has sold various goods from his shop such as lotions, cooking oil, biscuits, soap, Fanta, etc.

Jean Damascene has requested a 600,000 RWF loan from Vision Finance Company in order to buy more stock for his shop. With his profits he will be able to save for his future and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 25, is single and living with his parents and two working siblings. Since their father has spent his life working to sustain his family, he and his siblings work really hard to help him with this.

In 2005 Ali decided to open a beauty salon in the family’s home. He is considered very friendly and knows very well how to develop a good relationship with his customers.

Today Ali is requesting a 2,100,000 LBP youth loan from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more tools and supplies for his business. In the future he plans to open his own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy more tools and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en: Maroun is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one child. He’s the main income provider in his family, and strives to work really hard to collect money and offer them a fair way of living. For this reason, he decided to start his own business so he opened his own car mechanic shop a few years ago. In parallel, he has been working at a local garage since 2005. Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase extra mechanical tools and spare parts for his garage at special prices. He notes that this will improve his work and therefore allow him to earn superior income. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his garage.

loans.use: to purchase extra mechanical tools and spare parts for his garage at special prices

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 28 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. For the past four years she has sold sugar, sorghum, vegetables and fruit, rice, etc. She currently employs one person to help her.

Olive has requested a 300,000 RWF loan from Vision Finance Company in order to buy sugar, sorghum, vegetables and fruit, rice, etc. in bulk to sell. With her profits she will be able to save for her future and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sorghum, vegetables and fruit, rice, etc. in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 33 years old and is single. He sells soft drinks like Fanta and local drinks and he has been in this business for three years. 

Juvenal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more soft drinks like Fanta and local drinks for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks like Fanta and local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Elma Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Elma Cecilia, vive en la zona Pacifica Central de Costa Rica, en la provincia de Puntarenas, cantón de Osa, en el distrito de Sierpe, en la comunidad de Mogos, esta comunidad esta dentro del parque nacional de Corcovado, por esta razón no son propietarios de las tierras donde han construido sus casas, ya que el estado Costarricense lo que hace es otorgar un permiso para puedan vivir practicamente toda sus vidas.
La actividad productiva desarrollada por la señora Elma es la cría de cerdos para engorde, actualmente tiene una cerda que esta aumentada(preñada), y su plan de inversión es comprar otra cerda, que este aumentada, para engordarlos y venderlos despues; asi mismo es para la compra de concentrado ya que los cerditos recien nacidos necesitan una alimentación especial que contribuya a su desarrollo.
Como esta zona donde vive esta dentro del parque y muy cerca de la playa, en los últimos años ha existido un desarrollo turistico amigable con el ambiente, pero este desarrollo no alcanza a las mujeres mayores, ya que los hoteles demandan personal de ambos sexos con estudios a nivel técnico al menos en la rama de turismo y atención al cliente; la señora Elma es conciente de ello de allí que dentro de sus planes futuros esta el desarrollar la cría de cerdos, que le generara ingresos para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elma Cecilia lives in Costa Rica’s Central Pacific zone in Puntarenas Province, Osa Canton, Sierpe District, Mogos Community.  This community is inside the Corcovado National park so they don’t own the land they’ve built their house on because what the Costa Rican government does is issue a permit so that they can live there practically their entire lives.

The activity developed by Elma is raising pigs.  She currently has a pregnant sow and her investment plan is to buy another pregnant sow to fatten them up and sell them later.  She will also buy feed concentrate because newborn piglets need special nourishment that will contribute to their growth and development.

Because this zone she lives in is inside the park and very near the beach, ecotourism has grown lately but the development this brings does not benefit older women since the hotels require personnel of both sexes with technical level studies in tourism and customer service.  

Elma is conscious of this which is why raising pigs to generate income is in her future plans to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 38-year-old married woman with four children aged between nine and twenty years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman.

For the past fifteen years and with the assistance of one employee Eunice has run a mill where she grinds maize, millet and sorghum. Her mill is located along a busy road junction, and her primary customers are local residents. Additionally, she provides local transport, which increases her income. Her biggest business challenge is frequent power blackouts.

Eunice is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more maize. Her goal is to run another mill within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more maize to grind into flour.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. She has a business selling charcoal, both retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for seven years and works from her home. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

In addition to her charcoal business, she generates additional income selling fire wood. Her major business challenges include the rainy season and transportation of bags of charcoal from villages of Luwero to her home. Sarah is hoping to see her business grow bigger so that she earns enough profit to build rental rooms and buy a heifer cow, which she will use to start selling milk. She resides in her own home; her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is sixty years old and lives with her husband, Murad, in Abasha District, West Georgia. Murad works for a local company while Nargiza runs the family dairy. They have three milk cows that produce on average sixty kilograms of traditional Georgian cheese a month which they sell on the local open market to dairy product retailers.

The family also owns three hectares of land on which they grow maize. Nargiza uses the maize to feed the cows and sells the rest at the local market. The family’s total average monthly income is 350 GEL.

Nargiza requested a 1500 GEL loan from Credo to buy fertilizer and rent a tractor to till the family’s fields. By doing so the family can hope for a better harvest that can be sold for a higher price. Nargiza and Murad will use their profits to cover the family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rent a tractor to till the family’s fields.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 39-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 16 years. He describes himself as a patient man. He operates a taxi where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 11 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located along a busy road near a town and his primary customers are customers within the town and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high demand for transportation services with fewer taxis. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay for servicing of the taxi. His business goal is to own another taxi for transportation within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay for servicing of the taxi.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a divorced woman with two boys and four girls, all of whom are in school. She operates a grocery, and she sells her goods at the market to the local residents. She has been in this business for the past eight years, and she dreams of expanding her business and opening a kiosk. Saumu also sells fried potatoes as her side-business. She lives in a house that has no electricity or piped water. The lack of enough capital to expand her businesses is her major challenge, and it was also her motivation to join Yehu, so as to access loans.

The loan of KES 20,000 will enable her to purchase vegetables, potatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, potatoes, and cooking oil

loans.name: Narankhuu

texts.en: Narankhuu, 45, runs a taxi business in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running his business for 2 years and his daily earnings are about 30,000 MNT total. He lives with his wife and his 3 children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt which is on his plot of land. His wife is unemployed and 2 sons attend secondary school. Living in a ger is quite cold in the wintertime and it costs a lot for the heating by smoky coal. So he decided to build a new small house which will use a panel-heating system without any smoky coal usage. He thinks it is a very environmental and natural-oriented thing to decrease the air pollution around the city. Now he needs about 2,700,000 MNT to buy the necessary building materials to build his new family house.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials to build his new family house

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man who is trying his best to build a good future for his family, especially the children he hopes for. Since 2006 he has been working in construction on a freelance basis and specializing in floor cleaning. He also works as a plumber when needed. He’s sure that the more projects he takes on, the higher his revenues will be.

Today, he’s requesting a 1,500,000 LBP loan from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional cleaning equipment and plumbing supplies for his business. This will help him work better and more professionally.

In the future he plans to take out more loans and open his own construction equipment shop.

loans.use: to buy additional cleaning equipment and plumbing supplies.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima is married and has two children. Only one child goes to school. She has a business of selling charcoal and has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Prima has been in this business for 10 years and works seven days a week.  Besides this charcoal business, she also generates additional income through being a data entrant at Multiplex Uganda Ltd.  She sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis. Her business challenges include thieves and stiff competition from neighbors. She aspires to see her business grow so that she can get enough profit to start a grocery shop and do away with her charcoal business. She resides in a home that she owns, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
María es una mujer que tiene 37  años de edad, de estado civil  casada, además  cuenta con 04 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María vive en  el caserío Barrio Libre del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; asimismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 100 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  María es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; asimismo también esta dedicada a la  crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 4000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes); y así mismo hacer mejoramiento de su fachada de su casa, compra de calaminas  por temporadas de lluvias que se avecinan en el lugar; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 37-year-old married woman with four minor children in her care.  She lives with her spouse and children in her own house.  She says that the quality of life in the community is subsistence.  The majority of the residents are independent workers in commerce and raising small animals.  Some of them also work in agriculture.

María lives in the village of Barrio Libre in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura.  She has only basic electric services.  She also says that in the village approximately 100 families live in these conditions.

María's business is selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, mixed vegetables, eggs, milk, oil, noodles, detergent, sweets, beverages, etc.  She has her small store installed in her own home, where she attends to her loyal customers.  She also raises sheep and fowl in corrals outside her house.  It is worth emphasizing that María has five years of experience in this business, which has allowed her to keep her established customers in both businesses.  Her spouse supports her wholeheartedly in the work he does, there being a good family relationship between them.

Currently María has set out to expand the inventory regarding her commercial establishment (store) and her small animals.  This is because it is a very profitable business in the area.

This is why she is requesting a new loan for the amount of 4000 nuevos soles (PEN), which will be used to invest in buying merchandise (groceries) as well as in making improvements to the front of her house.  She will buy corrugated metal because of the rainy season that is approaching in the area.  This will allow her to continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: compra de abarrotes para su negocio y compra de calaminas para arreglar su casa

loans.name: Yesenia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Yesenia  es una mujer que tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, con un hijo a su cargo y es madre soltera, vive en casa propia con su hijo  y sus padres en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Yesenia se dedica a la  venta de prendas de vestir (ropa femenina y ropa para bebés), este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en una tienda en su propio domicilio, donde además de vender las prendas de vestir, ofrece al público productos de primera necesidad.  Con los ingresos que obtiene cubre sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Actualmente Yesenia se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio), esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por ello que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (ropas femeninas y ropas para bebés) y abarrotes, para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a 23 year old single woman with a son in her care; she’s a single mother living in her own house with her son and her parents.  It’s mentioned that quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers who are in agriculture, cattle raising and animal husbandry; some of them also work in commerce.  

Yesenia lives in her own house in the Andrés Razurí settlement in Tambogrande District of Piura Department; she only has electricity and water.  It’s also mentioned that almost all the families in this settlement live under these conditions.

The commercial activity Yesenia carries out is selling clothes (women’s clothing and clothes for infants).  She has this small business installed at home where she takes care of her loyal customers.  She also raises barnyard fowl and has two years’ experience which has made it possible for her to retain her established clientele in both businesses.  Her parents support her very much in all her activities since there’s a good family relationship among them.

Yesenia has proposed to expand her inventory with respect to her small business because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone and this is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new, 800 new sol, loan to buy merchandise (women’s and babies’ clothes).  She also has a short term goal of buying a stand in the market that in time will help her improve her and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, etc.) y ropa femenina y de bebés para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 45 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis. She is married and has one child.

Anecita has a vulcanizing  shop that repairs a lot of parts of vehicles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

Anecita  has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, she hopes to  have her own store someday.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Hilda Cecilia

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer que tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su hija  y su cónyuge en casa propia. Hilda vive en casa propia en el caserío Mocape del distrito de Olmos del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo no cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica. 

La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Hilda es la crianza, engorde y venta de ganado caprino, los cuales una vez que alcanzan su peso ideal los comercializa en la ciudad de Olmos, departamento de Lambayeque. Hilda cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 

Hilda se ha propuesto comprar más ganado caprino, para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo semanalmente en la ciudad de Olmos, así como comprar pasto para su alimentación.   Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de S/.2000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.

Hilda cuenta con buenas referencias personales, es trabajadora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and lives with her daughter and spouse in their own house. She says that the quality of life in her community is at a subsistence level. Most residents are independent workers who work in commercial activities or raising small animals, and some of them also work in agriculture. Hilda lives in her own home in the small village of Mocape, within the district of Olmos, in the department of Lambayeque. She also doesn't have access to basic electricity service, and they get their water from a manual well. All of the families who reside there also live in these conditions. 

Hilda's commercial activity is raising, fattening, and selling small animals, such as fowl and goats. She raises these animals in farmyards outside her home. However, she says that she sells them both at the local market and/or to wholesale buyers. Notably, Hilda has 10 years of experience, which has allowed her to maintain an established customer base in the business. Her spouse also supports her in this type of business, where they have a good family relationship.

Currently Hilda intends to expand her inventory regarding raising and selling animals (goats and fowl), due to the fact that this is a very cost-effective activity in her area. Because of these circumstances, she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles, which she will use to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals, vitamins, and to fix up her farmyards. This in time will allow her to gradually improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: Compra de ganado caprino y pastos para engordarlos y venderlos.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old and lives in Mitazan,  Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Veronica has a piggery. She has had this business for five (5) years. She requested a loan of 7000 to purchase feeds for her pigs business.
Veronica has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Veronica hopes that her other business will improve someday.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs business

loans.name: Diana Dolores

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer que tiene 23  años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 2 hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge. Diana vive en  el caserío Pueblo Viejo del distrito de Pacora en el departamento de  Lambayeque, de aproximadamente 50 familias.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en done vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, con lo cual garantizan el rápido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.  Su cónyuge se dedica a la a la agricultura y también trabaja como guardián de un fundo cercano a su localidad.

Diana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ovejas con las cuales piensa trabajar del mismo modo: engordándolas y vendiéndolas en la misma zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a EdpymeAlternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Diana es una mujer entregada a su familia  y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Diana is a 23-year-old woman who is married and has two dependent children.  She and her husband live in their own home.  It should be mentioned that the quality of life in her community is subsistent.   Most of the residents are independent workers who engage in trade and the breeding of small animals. Some of them also engage in agriculture.  Diana lives in the village of Pueblo Viejo in the District of Pacora, Department of Lambayeque.  The only service available is electricity and the drinking water comes from an artesian well.  All of the families that reside here must live under these conditions.

Diana's business involves raising and selling pigs, goats, and poultry.  The animals are kept in pens just outside of her home.  It should be noted that Diana has two years of experience in this business.  She has been able to maintain an established customer base.  The animals are sold to wholesale traders in the area.  Meanwhile, her husband works as a caretaker on a large farm in the district as a way of generating additional income.

At the moment, Diana plans to expand her inventory in terms of raising and selling animals since this type of business is very profitable in this area.  Under these circumstances, she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,200 PEN.  The money will be invested in the purchase of animal feed and repairs to the animal pens.  Over time, this will help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to pay for repairs to her animal pens.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a sus familia en el distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por encontrarse conformado por un pueblo central en donde se concentra todo el comercio y por varios caseríos aledaños en donde vive gente humilde y muy trabajadora, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de mujeres de la zona, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales para percibir ingresos, ella cría cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya ha acanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive.

Silvia desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría para percibir mayores ingresos, comprando alimento balanceado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Silvia es una mujer bastante conocida en la zona, sus vecinos le consideran una mujer honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
Silvia, 27, lives with her partner and their two dependent children in their own home. The livelihood of her community is based on subsistence agriculture, with most residence being self employed and involved in trade, small animal husbandry and agriculture. Silvia lives in the village of La Colorada, Morrope district, in the administrative division of Lambayeque. She has basic electricity services, and collects consumable water from an artesian well.  All the families who live there live in these conditions.

Silvia breeds and sells pigs. She breeds the animals in pens outside her home. She has two years experience in this trade, and has kept her established clientele. She sells her animals to wholesalers in her area, and her partner supports her in her business. 

Silvia is now seeking to increase her inventory in relation to breeding and selling animals. As this is a very profitable activity in her area, she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 soles which will be used to purchase feed and to maintain the animal pens, which in time will allow her to continue to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced animal feed, and to maintain the pens for her animals.

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Sebastián  es un hombre que tiene 24  años de edad, de estado civil soltero, sin hijos,  vive  en casa propia con sus padres. Sebastián vive en  el caserío La Capilla Santa Rosa del distrito de Mochumi, una localidad dedicada principalmente a la agricultura que se encuentra situada en la localidad de Lambayeque, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Sebastián es la crianza/venta de ganado Caprino, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años.  El ganado es ofrecido en venta cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo. Con estos ingresos ayuda a su familia en el sostenimiento diario de la economía familiar.  Asimismo también labora como jornalero en un molino de arroz, lo que le permite tener otros ingresos. 

Sebastián desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales para así poder venderlos rápidamente, para que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a 24-year-old single man without children.  He lives in his own house with his parents.  He mentions that the quality of life in the community is subsistence.  The majority of the residents are independent workers in trade and raising small animals, and some also work in agriculture.

Sebastián lives in the hamlet of La Capilla Santa Rosa in the district of Mochumi in the department of Lambayeque, and has only basic electric service.  He gets his water from a communal tap.  All the families there live under these conditions.

The business Sebastián works in is raising and selling livestock (goats, pigs, sheep, and poultry).  He raises these animals in corrals outside his home.  It is worth emphasizing that Sebastián has two years of experience in this work, which has allowed him to keep his established clientele.  He sells his animals to the wholesale vendors of the area.  He also works as a day laborer in a rice mill, which allows him to have additional income.

Currently Sebastián has decided to expand his inventory for raising and selling animals because it is a very profitable business in the area.  This is why he is requesting another loan from Edpyme Alternative for the sum of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN), which will be invested in buying balanced feed and repairing the corrals for his animals.  In time this will allow him to continue improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to repair the corrals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more  fish to sell.

loans.name: Edison Froilan

texts.es:
EDISON FROILAN tiene 24 años es soltero tiene 1 hijo, vive con el hijo y unos familiares en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

EDISON FROILAN es un maestro soldador.  Solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina soldadora y herramientas para trabajar cómo barillas, casco protector, playo, martillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la maquinaria que tanta falta le hacía. Las compras lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder poner un negocio que crezca en un 100 % y crear fuentes de empleo.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder especializarce en soldadura. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Edison Froilan is 24 years old, single, and has a son.  He lives with his son and some relatives in Guaranda, in Bolivar province.

Edison Froilan is a master welder.  He is requesting a loan to buy a welding machine and tools for his work, including metal rods, a protective helmet, pliers, and a hammer.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the equipment that he badly needs.  He will make his purchases in Guaranda.

His dream is to be able to have a business that is growing by 100% and is creating a source of employment.  The challenge he faces is being able to specialize in welding.  

In his free time, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and tools for his work, including metal rods, a protective helmet, pliers, and a hammer

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
PAULO CESAR tiene 29 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.

 PAULO CESAR se dedica a arreglar vehículos el es Ingeniero Mecánico. Solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas cómo brocas, ejes, baterias. cion la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar el taller donde trabaja. 

Las compras lo hará en Ambato. El sueño es poder ampliar el taller y dar trabajo a personas que lo necesitan.

El desfío al que se enfrenta es poder trabajar por mucho tiempo más. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
PAULO CESAR is 29 years old, single and has no children. He lives with relatives in Guaranda in Bolivar Province.

PAULO CESAR is dedicated to repairing automobiles. He is a mechanical engineer. He is applying for a loan to purchase tools such as bits, axles and batteries. With the help of the loan he will be able to improve the workshop where he works.

He will buy the tools in Ambato. His dream is to be able to expand his workshop and provide work for those who need it.

The challenge he faces is to be able to work for a much longer time. In his spare time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as bits, axles and batteries.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela de 29 años, casada y madre de dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 9, se dedica a la actividad comercial, mediante un punto de ventas o miscelánea, ubicado en su propio hogar, donde los vecinos de su barrio y de los alrededores, encuentran muchos artículos para la familia, como papelería, mercancías para el hogar, productos desechables, artículos de la canasta familiar etc. Con este negocio, iniciado hace 4 años a un lado de su vivienda, logra ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento del bienestar de su hogar. Cada vez mas, su clientela se incrementa y responderle en temporadas de gran movimiento comercial, se convierte en su gran desafío, por eso requiere capital de trabajo, para poder salirle al paso a su creciente demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, productos desechables y de miscelánea, para tener un inventario suficiente, con artículos de mayor rotación y se ahorraría los costos del incremento constante de los productos que vende, además de obtener  un mayor descuento por el volumen de sus compras. Lo que se convierte en las principales razones de éxito de su inversión credikiva, complementada con su gran experiencia en el manejo de la clientela. Su meta mas adelante es lograr un mayor creciminto de su negocio convirtiendose en la mas grande disribuidora del sector; Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar no mayor del 36%, una rotación de inventarios  de 54 dias, indicadores finacieros,aapropiados para este tipo de negocios y desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento empresarial
texts.en:
Marciela is 29 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of two children that are 4 and 9 years old.  She sells miscellaneous items from her home, where her neighbors and people from nearby neighborhoods come to find items for their households, such as stationary, household goods, disposable products, items for basic needs, etc.  

She began this business 4 years ago next door to her home and she earned a sufficient income to support her household.  In time, her customers increased and the growing demand became her biggest challenge.  She needed capital in order to support the needs of all her customers.  This is why she contacted credikiva.  This will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She seeks the loan so that she can buy a larger volume than she normally buys (of disposable and miscellaneous products), so that she has sufficient supply of the items that sell quickly.  This will also lower her costs of constantly buying the products that she sells, as she will get a volume discount for buying in bulk.

Her goal is to support her growing business and to become the biggest supplier in her sector.  To meet this goal, she will manage a turnover of accounts receivable of less than 36% with an inventory turnover of 54 days. Her financial advisors indicate that this is appropriate for her type of business and from her projected business growth.

loans.use: to buy disposable and miscellaneous products in bulk.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомджон добрый и трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 13 лет он занимается выращиванием картошки, а также купле- продажей скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль. С прибылью он хочет отремонтировать свой дом и построить новый сарай. Илхомджон запрашивает займ для покупки семян картошки, минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов, а также на остальную сумму хочет купить скот. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a kind and hardworking person.  He is married and raising three children.  He has been involved in growing potatoes and also buying and selling livestock for over 13 years.  Ilhomjon wants to expand his business in order to make a good profit.  He wants to use the profit to repair his shouse and build a new barn.  Ilhomjon is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticides, and also to buy livestock with the rest of the sum.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: María Yojaira

texts.es: María Joraira, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casada, vive con sus hijos y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de almácigo y fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la siembre y asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de suelo y topografía que cuenta el terreno para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto o mediano plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María Joraira is 28 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children who are her main priority.  She plans to use her loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and to pay laborers for the planting and care of coffee.  In this way, she will be sure to do a good job.  She intends to take advantage of the good soil conditions and topography that exist for this crop as well as put her experience managing coffee into practice. In addition, the loan will enable her to purchase better products of higher quality so that her plantation has good growth and health and adequate production in a short or medium cycle.  This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She hasn’t had any other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for planting coffee.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
JOSE MANUEL tiene 59 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 20 años de edad en guaranda provincia de bolívar.

JOSE MANUEL es auxiliar de Servicios, además tiene ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado vacuno. 

Con la yuda del crédito  podra comprar el animal para dedicarse a la ganadería. La compra lo hará en Guaranda. 

El sueño es poder establecerse como ciomerciante de ganado. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta seguir trabajando y apoyar a la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel is 59 years old, he is married, he has one child, and he lives with this wife and son (who is 20 years old) in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Jose Manuel is a provider of services and he also has cattle.  He is seeking a loan to buy cattle.  With the help from this loan, he will be able to buy more animals and focus on raising cattle.  He will buy the cattle in Guaranda.

He is dream is to be able to establish himself as a cattle dealer.  In his free time he likes to work and to support his family.  He also likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзод женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 11 лет он занимается выращиванием картошки и пшеницы. Также занимается скотоводством. С прибыли он хочет ремонтировать свой дом. Шерзод хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян картошки, минеральных удобрений, ядохимикатов и горюче-смазочных материалов. Шерзод надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Sherzod is married and raising two children.  He has been involved in growing potatoes and wheat for over 11 years.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  He wants to use his profits to repair his house.  Sherzod wants to obtain this loan to buy potato seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides and fuel and lubricants.  Sherzod relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Jairo Nahin

texts.es:
JAIRO NAHIN tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

JAIRO NAHIN es mecánico soldador. Solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina soldadora.  

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar la máquina.La compra lo hara en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprar una moto. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor. "Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Jairo Nahin is 22 years old, he is single, and he does not have children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the province of los Ríos.

Jairo Nahin is a welder.  He is seeking a loan to buy a welding machine.  With the help from the loan, he will be able to buy the machine.  He will buy it in Ventanas.

His dream is to be able to buy a motorcycle.  In his free time he likes to play 'indor.'  He says that he is very thankful for this help that is being offered to him.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a married man. He has four children between the ages of 26 and 32. He describes himself to be an outgoing and focused man. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for nine years and employs one staff member. His business is located at a favorable area for dairy farming. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a nappier grass chopper machine. His business goal is to run a well equipped dairy farm in the nearby town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have at least ten cows from the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy a nappier grass chopper machine

loans.name: Zulfali

texts.en:
Zulfali is a 60-year-old, married man with three children. He is a market vendor; specifically, he sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candy. He has seven years of experience in this business and therefore has a great deal of knowledge about the market and the demands of customers. Zulfali is a very successful entrepreneur, partly because of his shop's great location in the central bazaar of his home town. 

Food products he sells are very popular among the local people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling various foods is approximately 300 AZN.  His son helps him purchase products and bring them to the shop. He is the sole source of income for his family. 

He applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to purchase more food products and to diversify the range of goods to satisfy his customers` demands.

loans.use: to meet customers' needs by purchasing additional food products and goods

loans.name: Víctor Tulio

texts.es: Víctor Tulio, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Víctor Tulio, 30, is married and lives with his son and his wife, who are his biggest priority.  With his loan he expects to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to help grow coffee, and in this way guarantee that he will do a good job.

What he hopes for is to make the most of the good climate and soil conditions for this crop, and to put into practice his experience managing coffee.  In addition, he wants to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so his crop has good and healthy growth and he has suitable production in the short term.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comite San Cayetano se formo en el chaco con la unión de 10 mujeres. Todas ellas son muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras y también ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Yolanda es muy trabajadora y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, tiene buena clientela siempre porque últimamente el carbón es más barato. Gracias a su buen precio y a su amabilidad ha podido ir creciendo, lo que le ha ayudado mucho.
Su meta es seguir trabajando, es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón para poder estar bien abastecida y de esa forma surtir a sus clientes. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo, pues depositaron  en ellas su confianza.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Communal Bank was formed in El Chaco with the assembling of 10 women. All of them are very hardworking and want very much to succeed and to help one another and also help their children and families.

Yolanda is very hardworking and tells us that she sells charcoal. She has a good clientele, because charcoal is cheaper lately. Thanks to her good prices and her friendliness she has been able to grow her customer base, which has greatly helped her.

Her goal is to continue working. Consequently she is applying for a loan in order to purchase charcoal and to be well supplied and thereby meet her customers’ demands. She and her group are grateful for the help they are receiving and for the trust you placed in them.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.ru: Abdulla rabotaet masterom. On delaet remont I stroit doma. U nego 19 let opita v etoy sfere. Abdulla jenat, emu 45 let I 4-go vzsroslix detey vozrastov ot 18 do 23. On planiruet nachat semeyniy selskoxozaystenniy biznes. Prodavat’ molochnie produkti. Eto pomojet emu obespechivat projivanie I pitanie ego semyi luchshe. Abdulla xochet kupit odnu korovu I poetomu obratilsa za summoy 600 AZN.
texts.en: Abdulla works as a carpenter, building houses and carrying out repairs. He has 19 years of experience in this area. He is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 18-23. Abdulla is planning to start a family farming business and sell dairy products. This will help him to provide better living conditions for his family. He would like to purchase a cow, which is why he is requesting a loan of 600 AZN.

loans.use: to buy a cow and start selling dairy products

loans.name: Carla Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Carla Lorena, de 41 años de edad, casada, de oficio maestra de educación primaria. Su núcleo familiar compuesto por cuatro personas. Actualmente esta necesitando realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda.

Se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un crédito que le permita de esta manera realizar su sueño ya que requiere comprar los materiales de construcción como cemento, pintura, piso, zinc, arena entre otros, con el propósito de tener una mayor comodidad y mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Carla Lorena is 41 years old, married, and works as an elementary school teacher. Her family includes four individuals. She currently needs to make a few improvements to her home. Carla came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan that would allow her to fulfill her dream.

She needs to buy construction materials such as cement, paint, flooring, zinc, and other supplies, so that she can provide greater comfort and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, flooring, zinc, sand, and other materials.

loans.name: Concepción De Lourdes

texts.es: Concepción tiene 35 años de edad, es casada su esposo reside en el extranjero. y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes. Concepción tiene un negocio de pulpería. Lo estableció hace 4 años con el objetivo de poder tener otro ingreso extra en el hogar y poder superarse. Ella ha logrado mantener su negocio con la buena administración y con la ayuda de su esposo. Vende productos alimenticos como, huevos, manteca, frijoles, azúcar, harina, leche, refrescos y productos de abarrotería como, jabón, desinfectantes, pastas dentales, papel higiénico entre otros. A su negocio le dedica tiempo completo para atender a sus clientes. esta solicitando un segundo prestamo por 21,000.00 lempiras el que invertirá en la compra de abarrotería como, papel higiénico, jabón para la lavar y de baño, desinfectante, pastas dentales etc. Para ofrecer mejor variedad de productos a los clientes y así su negocio pueda crecer aun mas en clientes. Su plan en el futuro es ampliar más el negocio y seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Concepción, 35, is married; her husband lives abroad. She has three children who are 14, 10 and 2 years old. She lives in a village in Peña Blanca, Cortes.

Concepción has a grocery store. She opened it four years ago aiming at having an additional source of income for her home and to be able to improve herself. She’s managed to stay in business thanks to her good administration and with help from her husband. She sells food items like eggs, lard, beans, sugar, flour, milk, soft-drinks and grocery items like soap, disinfectant, toothpaste, and toilet paper, among others. She works full-time in her store in order to take care of customers.

She is currently asking for a 21,000 lempira loan to buy grocery items like toilet paper, laundry detergent and bath soap, disinfectant, and toothpaste, etc.   She will do this in order to have a greater variety of products available for customers so that the business will grow with even more customers. Her plan for the future is to expand the business more and to continue working to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Masias

texts.es:
El socio Masias nació en el centro poblado menor de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive donde nació, él tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. El socio Masias se dedica a agricultura y ganadería, él tiene pequeños terrenos de cultivo en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Masias requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes. 

El socio Masias pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Masias was born in the town center of Yanahuara in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  He lives where he was born, he is 54 years old, he is married, and his has four children.

Masias works in agriculture and raises livestock.  He has a small farm at home.  He has worked in this business for many years, and thanks to the effort he puts into his work, it has gone very well.  Masias is seeking a loan so that he can buy compost and fertilizers.

Masias belongs to the community bank “San Martin de Yanahuara” in the Arariwa Association in the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2007 года. Она на дому печет лепешки. У нее есть помощники, которые помогают печь национальный хлеб. Одна из работников делает тесто и изготавливает круглые колобки, другая  разжигает костер в тандыре (специальная печь) тем самым согревая тандыр. Ее муж развозит лепешки по заказу. А также у них есть постоянные клиенты, которые из дома забирают лепешки  с раннего утра. Настоящий кредит получает для  запаса муки.Она благодарит за финансовую поддержку КИВА.
texts.en: Hafiza has been partnering with our organization since 2007.  She bakes flatbread at home.  She has assistants, who help her to bake national flatbread.  One of the employees makes dough and forms balls of dough, and the other makes fire in a tandoor (specialized oven) and heats up the tandoor.  Hafiza's husband delivers flatbread orders.  They also have regular customers, who pick up flatbread from their home since early morning.  Hafiza is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour.  She is grateful for the Kiva financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis con su credikiva anterior compró al por mayor y de contado, artículos deportivos y mercancía en general, como camisetas, pantalonetas, gorras, medias, banderas, afiches, blusas, faldas y demás variedades. Con su nuevo credikiva planea surtir sus nuevos dos locales con mayor cantidad de artículos deportivos y de temporada según las fechas en as cuales se incrementan sus ventas, como el día de las madres, del padre etc. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero que me han brindado, espero seguir creciendo en mi negocio y mejorando mi nivel de vida y el de mi familia, con ustedes y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. “
texts.en:
With his last Kiva loan, Luis bought sports equipment and general merchandise like t-shirts, shorts, hats, socks, flags, posters, blouses, skirts and various other items in both bulk and with cash.

With his new Kiva loan he plans to stock up his 2 new businesses with a larger quantity of sports equipment and seasonal items for the times of the year when his sales tend to increase like mother's day, father's day etc.

His message to Kiva's lenders is as follows: "Thank you very much for the financial support you have given me, I hope to keep expanding my business and improving the level of life for myself and my family, with you and with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo."

loans.use: to stock up his businesses with a larger quantity of sports equipment and seasonal items.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El Comite Santa Rita es de Chaco, están en el primer ciclo, empezando a trabajar juntas. Tienen deseos de superación y ganas de salir adelante. Sebastiana es parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y leche.
Sebastiana comenta que trabaja desde muy temprano todos los días para poder llevar la leche que vende a las mesas de sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, emprendedora y por sobre todo muy honesta, esta contenta con lo que hace porque gracias a esto ha podido mantener a su familia.
Ella quiere seguir invistiendo en su negocio por lo que pide la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de leche y queso, con lo cual tendrá esos productos en stock.
texts.en:
The Santa Rita group is from Chaco.  They are in the first loan cycle and just beginning to work together.  They hope to excel and to get ahead.

Sebastiana is part of the group and she sells cheese and milk.  She says that she works very early every day to be able to bring the milk that she sells to the tables of her customers.  She is a hard-working, resourceful, and above all, a very honest person.  She is happy with what she does because it has thankfully supported her family.

She wants to continue investing in her business and so she is asking for Kiva's help and for help from the Paraguayan Foundation.  She needs to purchase milk and cheese and keep these products in stock.

loans.use: to purchase milk and cheese.

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Jaime se dedica a la carpinteria y albañileria, esta separado de su esposa e hijas que estan en edad escolar, a pesar de ello, el las apoya con sus gastos, las visita y ocupa  parte de su tiempo con ellas.
Hace poco sufrio un robo de toda su herramienta que utilizaba para hacer dichos trabajos, se ha visto en la necesidad de pedir apoyo para solventar nuevas herraminetas para no dejar sin ayuda economica a su esposa e hijas.
texts.en:
Jaime works in carpentry and building.  He is separated from his wife and daughters, who are of school age.  In spite of this, he supports them with their expenses, visits them, and spends part of his time with them.

Recently he was robbed of all the tools he used for his jobs.  He has no choice but to request help to pay for new tools so his wife and daughters are not left without financial support.

loans.use: to buy work tools for carpentry and building.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
El socio Serapio nació en el centro poblado menor de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive donde nació, él tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos. El socio Serapio es albañil y se dedica a la construcción de casas, calles y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Serapio requiere el préstamo para aumentar la cuota que necesita para comprar un terreno para que después pueda construir una casa. 

El socio Serapio pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Serapio was born in the small town of Yanahuara, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco, and he lives where he was born.  He is 35 years old and married, and has six children from this beautiful relationship.

Serapio is a bricklayer and he builds houses, streets, and other things.  He has had this business for several years now and it is going excellently for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Serapio needs the loan to increase the amount necessary to buy a plot of land so later he can build a house.

Serapio belongs to San Martín de Yanahuara Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Hurriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо женщина в возрасте 38 лет, работает  медсестрой.Она замужем имеет троих детей.Муж на заробтах в Российской Федерации.Каждый месяц муж высылает им деньги но эти денежные средства уходят только на семейные нужды.Поэтому Хуринисо дома дополнительно занимается откормом скота.Дети ей помогают.На полученный кредит Хуринисо хочет приобрести корм для скота.Она получает кредит в первые и обещает  целенаправленно использовать этот кредит.
texts.en: Hurriniso is a 38 year-old woman, who works as a nurse.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  He sends money home every month, but these monetary means cover only the family's needs.  This is why Hurriniso is additionally involved in fattening up livestock at home.  Her children help her.  Hurriniso wants to use this loan to buy livestock feed.  This is her first loan, and she promises to use the loan as intended.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Ostmaro

texts.es: Juan Ostmaro de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos, él se dedica a la cosecha de maíz y maicillo o sorgo en un cantón altamente agrícola, tiene mas de 15 años de experiencia y sabe que este es el mejor tiempo de siembra, es un excelente comerciante y tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo es producido de primera calidad y les da un precio de venta accesible además el servicio es muy bueno, es el más amable de la zona; además cuando no es tiempo de siembra se emplea en los campos donde cortan caña de azucar y ahí el es mandador o capataz que le trae también muy buenas ganancias; Juan es un hombre muy responsable, trabajador y siempre aprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que no hay nada que tenga más interés en la vida, que intentar conseguir un sueño, él quiere invertir en su cosecha por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que permita comprar semilla de maíz y sorgo, fertilizante, insecticida y algunas herramientas. Juan tiene la certeza que podrá ir saldando el financiamiento cada mes, y tiene la esperanza que le permitirá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Juan Ostmaro is 34 years old.  He lives with his life partner and their 4 children.  His business is cultivating corn and sorghum in a highly agricultural area.  He has over 15 years of experience and knows that this is the best time for planting.  He is an excellent businessman and has many customers.  They know that all of his products are top quality and he gives them a reasonable price and very good service.  He is the friendliest in the area.  When it is not planting season he works as a foreman in the fields where they cut sugarcane and this also provides good earnings.  Juan is very responsible and hardworking and he always takes advantage of the opportunities that are presented to him.  He thinks there is nothing more interesting in life than trying to achieve your dreams.  He wants to invest in his crops so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase corn and sorghum seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools. Juan is sure he will be able to pay for the financing each month, and he hopes this will allow him to provide financial security to his family.

loans.use: to purchase corn and sorghum seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and tools.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.es: Emelda con su credikiva compró materis primas e insumos con los cuales elaboró productos y respondió a pedidos en su carpinteria. así mismo invirtió en telas e hilos y elaboró hermosos diseños de confecciónes, que tambien estaban encargados. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprara madera y pintura para elaborar nuevos muebles, pedidos que tiene para repsonder el dia de las madrs y así mismo invertirá en su otro negocio de confecciones, negocio que tambien quiere fortalecer. Su mensaje a los fianciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Estoy muy agradecida, espero que me sigan apoyando a pesar de las dificultades que se me han presentado por problemas de salud.
texts.en:
With Emelda's first credikiva loan, she bought materials and supplies with which she developed her products and fulfilled her customer's orders in her carpentry business.  She also invested in fabrics and thread and created beautifully designed apparel.  

She is now applying for a new credikiva loan which she will use to buy wood and paint to create new furniture, as she wants to fulfill orders for Mother's Day.  She will also invest in her apparel business, a business that she wants to strengthen. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  "I am very thankful and I hope that you continue supporting me in spite of some difficulties due to problems with my health."

loans.use: to purchase wood and paint.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Martha Isabel, reside en el departamento de Masaya, comerciante, posee su propio negocio una pequeña pulpería el cual tiene dos años, también comercializa la venta de cajetas hechas a base de coco elaboradas por ella misma, ella  comenta que busca la manera de poder moverse en el mercado y de algún modo buscar sus ingresos que le permita mantener a su familia.  Sus compras las realiza en el mercado municipal de Masaya, para reabastecer su pulpería.
Se presenta a nuestra oficinas para poder solicitar un préstamo que le permita comprar  arroz faisán, azúcar, aceite, leña en raja y en manojo, cocos, gaseosas y golosinas, que es lo que mas le es demandado por sus clientes. Por la temporada ella considera que la demanda es buena. Necesita invertirle a si negocio, de tal manera que le permita dar un mejor servicio y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Martha Isabel resides in Masaya Department. She is a trader and runs her own business, a small store which she has had for two years. She also sells “cajetas” (a typical sweet) made with a coconut base, which she prepares herself. She notes that she is looking for a way to be able to move into the market and in some way generate an income that will enable her to support her family. She makes the purchases to restock her store in the municipal market of Masaya.

She came to our offices to apply for a loan that will allow her to buy Faisan rice, sugar, oil, firewood in splits and in bundles, coconuts, soft drinks and candies. These are all items that are in highest demand by her customers. She believes demand is good for the season. She needs to invest in her business in such a way that it will enable her to provide better service to her customers and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase Faisán rice, sugar, oil, firewood in splits and in bundles, coconuts, soft drinks and candy.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma nació en la ciudad de Echarati de la provincia de La Convencion del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el centro poblado de Yanahuara de la Provincia  de Urubamba, ella tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. La socia Norma es artesana y se dedica a la elaboración de cerámica en una empresa privada  de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Norma requiere el préstamo para aumentar la cuota que necesita para comprar un mototaxi para que su esposo puede brindar servicio de transporte rural. 

La socia Norma pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Norma was born in the city of Echarati in La Convención Province in Cusco Department but currently lives in the settlement of Yanahuara in Urubamba Province.  She’s 27-years-old and is in a common law relationship; she has a son.

Norma’s a craftswoman; she makes ceramics in a private firm in the city of Urubamba.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Norma needs the loan to increase the down payment she needs to buy a mototaxi so that her husband can work providing rural transportation service.  

Norma belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s  “San Martín de Yanahuara” communal bank in Cusco department.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with six children, and only two of her children go to school. She has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years. Other than her clothing business, Betty owns a small grocery store. She works six days a week at the market. 

Betty has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can build her own shop from where she can work. She also aspires to become a wholesaler. 

Betty resides in a home that she rents. Her family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Betty’s monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with four children. Only three of her children go to school. She has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 15 years and retails to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Besides this clothing business she also sells piped water. Her major business challenges include thieves and ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can become a wholesaler and be able to start importing used clothes. She resides in a home that she owns and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Hadjah's monthly expenses include school fees, paying for utility bills, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 51 years old. She lives in a small village in the Abasha District with her husband, Roland, and 20-year-old daughter. All family members are involved in the family agriculture business, which is the only source of the income for them. The family owns a dairy farm with four milk cows. Nora produces traditional West Georgian cheese and sells 50 – 55 kg of this product per month at the local open market. The family also has 2.5 hectare land where maize is grown. Nora and Roland sell harvested maize at the local market as well. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Nora requested a loan in order to expand the family dairy farm. She will purchase an additional milk cow and increase production and sales of cheese by 25%. She also plans to start a new small business. With part of the loan, Nora will purchase clothes on the wholesale market and sell them in the village. She will reinvest the profit in the same business and increase the turnover. As a result of these investments, the family's income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Viviana Isabel

texts.es:
Viviana vive en la ciudad de Mala, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas hermosas, por el cariño que puede ofrecer sus pobladores y por su agricultura. Viviana es madre soltera, saca adelante a du hijo de 3 años de edad sola ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y desde ese momento se convirtió en padre y madre para su hijo pero es su hijo quien le da la fuerza para salir adelante cada con solo mirar sus ojos y su sonrisa. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta leer y escuchar música junto a su pequeño, en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “pescado frito”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Todos los días Viviana se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus labores como ama de casa y a la vez trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucho carisma para atender a los clientes.

Viviana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y mejoraran sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Viviana lives in the city of Mala, a city noted for having beautiful beaches, for its residents’ friendliness and for its agriculture.  Viviana is a single mother who is raising her three-year-old son alone because her child’s father abandoned them and since that moment she became both father and mother to her son.  But it is her son who gives her the strength to continue forward by just smiling at her and looking at her.  When she has free time available she likes to read and listen to music alongside her little one; occasionally she enjoys one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Pescado Frito.”  She only attended secondary school but would have like to have studied Nursing.

Viviana rises very early every day to do her household chores and at the same time work in her grocery selling business.  She dedicates about 10 hours daily to her store and can tend to up to 15 customers per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because she has much charisma to take care of customers.

Viviana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her store like rice, sugar, noodles and canned goods, among others in order to have more products to offer her customers.  Her income will increase and she will be able to continue working and striving toward reaching her greatest dream:   to have a house of her own and to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 38 years old. She is a married woman with five children between the ages of three and seventeen years. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell, and earn 6,000 PHP per month. 

Merilyn hopes to increase their income and to be able to sustain her family, especially her children's education. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, certified seeds and other farm supplies. Merilyn hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, certified seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 49-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 5 children between the ages of 9 and 22 years. Nilda runs a fishing business with her husband. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys more fish from other fishermen. 

Nilda is hoping to make a better income so that she and her husband can sustain their children's education. She applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and lead weights. Nilda hopes to have a greater business profitability. She also hopes that in the future her family will have a more stable living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and lead weights.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia nació en el centro poblado de Yanahuara de la Provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive donde nació, ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos. Su actividad económica de la socia Julia es la venta de verduras y chicha. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Julia requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como por ejemplo zapallo, lechuga, papas, tomates, cebolla y otras cosas más. 

La socia Julia pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Julia was born in the Yanahuara settlement in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department and still lives where she was born.  She’s 50-years-old and married; she has six children.  

Julia’s economic activity is selling vegetables and chicha [beverage made from corn].  She’s been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

Julia needs the loan to buy vegetables like pumpkins, lettuce, potatoes, tomatoes, onions and others.
