She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “San Martín de Yanahuara” communal bank in Cusco Department.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of four children and all of her children go to school. She has a business selling bananas and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. As a retailer, she sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she may sell only wholesale, and to educate her children up to university. She resides in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Lileth

texts.en: Lileth is 22 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is still single and supports her family by raising hogs. She earns about 8000 PHP per month with this business. Lileth requested a loan to purchase more pigs. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for three months. Aside from her clothing business, she generates additional income from selling piped water. Norah works seven days a week.

Norah has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include the transportation of clothing bales and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. Norah aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start importing used clothes. She also aspires to build her own house. 

Norah resides in a home that she rents. Her family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is a 51 year-old farmer from Vani District, West Georgia. He lives with his wife, Maya, three daughters (14, 5 and 1 year old) and parents (pensioners). Maya is an English language teacher and she has students. Paata runs the agricultural business of the family. In particular, he is busy with a family-owned plot of land. Paata grows melons, maize and nuts. He sells 8 tons of melons, 4 tons of maize and 450 kg of nuts on average per year. Paata sells the harvested products locally to greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Paata requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and for renting a tractor to till the land. After tilling and fertilizing the plot, Paata will work hard during the spring and summer seasons. He hopes that the weather conditions are favorable as well, and that he will get a good harvest in late summer, which can be sold for a fair price through the known channels. Paata will use the profit for the well-being of his children and financing the education of the elder daughter.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the plot and to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de deux enfants.Elle vit dans une maison étroite où elle a loué avec son mari deux chambres. Depuis deux ans, ils construisent leur propre maison dans un des nouveaux quartiers de leur localité. Afin de terminer les travaux et de déménager, elle sollicite un prêt de 350000f pour acheter de portes, des fenêtres et des carreaux.
texts.en: Ndella is a married woman. She is the mother of two children. She lives in a narrow, two-room house that she rents with her husband. For two years, they have been building a house in one of the new areas of town. In order to finish the construction work and move, she is asking for a loan of 350,000f to buy doors, windows, and tiles.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, and tiles.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in Trinidad, Bohol. He is able to support his family through his business. He also tills a small parcel of land to grow rice crops. His harvest is consumed by the family and the rest is sold. 

Teofilo works hard to sustain his family. He has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and farm fertilizers. Teofilo hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят – 56 лет,  вдова, имеет 2 детей на иждивении. Старшие дочь и сын уже имеют свои семьи. Она кредитуется в нашей организации с 2010 года и ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования, а также показала себя с хорошей стороны. В течении кредитования  Хикоят вместе с мужем  женили старшего сына и выдали замуж дочь. Но к сожалению муж Хикоят умер, но она до сих пор сотрудничает с нашей организацией. Хикоят работает в государственном учреждении. Не давно дочь Хикоят родила девочку. По нашим традициям она 40 дней должна быть у матери. Очередной кредит хочет получить для проведения мероприятия внучки (гахворабандон). Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку и благодарна вам.
texts.en: Khikoyat is 56 years old, a widow and is supporting two children.  Her oldest daughter and son already have their own families.  Khikoyat has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2010 and never violated our terms and conditions, and also showed herself well.  During the financing period, Khikoyat and her husband married off their oldest son and daughter.  Unfortunately, Khikoyat's husband died, but she is still working with our organization to this day.  Khikoyat works at a municipal organization.  Recently, Khikoyat's daughter gave birth to a daughter.  According to our traditions, she has to spend 40 days with the mother.  Khikoyat wants to obtain this loan to hold an event for her granddaughter (gahvorabandon).  She relies on your help and support and is grateful to you.

loans.use: to hold an event for her granddaughter

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hija en una colonia Suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Carmen, es una persona muy trabajadora le enseño su madre desde muy pequeña a comercializar, ella vende frutas y verduras de todo tipo en una bicicleta, sale a ofrecer producto de casa en casa todos los días porque necesita obtener más ingresos para complementar los gastos del hogar.
solicita un préstamo de 5,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de mas verduras y frutas como ser papas, tomate, repollo, bananos, piñas, mangos etc. para vender y crecer en clientes, ya que su meta es ampliar su zona de clientes y en un futuro comprar un vehículo para llevar más producto y movilizarse mejor. muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado de ODEF y Kiva.
texts.en:
Carmen, 23, is married living with her husband and daughter in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Carmen is a very hardworking person whose mother taught her from a very young age to be a merchant; she sells fruit and all kinds of vegetables on a bicycle.  She goes out house to house selling her products because she needs to earn more money to cover household expenses.

She’s asking for a 5,000 lempira loan to buy more vegetables and fruit like potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, bananas, pineapples, mangoes, etc. to sell and increase her clientele because her goal is to expand her customer area and in the future buy a vehicle to carry more products and get around more easily.  

She’s very grateful for the financial support offered by ODEF and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
El socio Casimiro nació en la ciudad de Echarati en la Provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero ahora vive en el centro poblado menor de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba, él tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene ocho hijos. El socio Casimiro se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más, él tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Casimiro requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y otras cosas más. 

El socio Casimiro pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Casimiro is a member who was born in the city of Echarati in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. He now lives in the central village of Yanahuara in Urubamba Province. Casimiro is 50 years old, married, and has eight children. He produces furniture out of wood such as wardrobes, chairs, tables, and other pieces. Casimiro has a small carpentry workshop in his home. He has been in this business for several years and has done excellent work as a result of the effort he puts into his job.

Casimiro is requesting a loan in order to buy wood and other supplies. He is a member of the Communal Bank "San Martin de Yanahuara", which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the Department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy wood and other supplies.

loans.name: Vecinas Y Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Vecinas Y amigas” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, artículos de aseo, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa por catalogo, almacén, venta de miel, servicio entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de colina ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Paula, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en el centro de la segunda fila, viste una polera blanca, su Cabello lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa nueva, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 3 años.
Su mercadería la compra en Santiago o por encargo a la ciudad de la Ligua.
Con el crédito comprará chalecos de diferentes tallas y modelos para su clientela. Sus metas son poder tener una  tienda, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Paula vive junto a su marido, quien trabaja como minero, y sus 3 hijos que estudian. Sus sueños son tener una tienda.
Paula está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
The Community Bank, “Vecinas Y Amigas” (Neighbors and Friends) is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work in various trades, including clothing sales, toilet repair products, perfume sales, catalog clothing sales, general store sales, honey sales, etc. All the members belong to the community of Colina, in the city of Santiago.

Paula is the president of the Community Bank, and in the photo, she is standing in the center of the second row, and is dressed in a white shirt with her hair up. She makes a living selling new clothing, and she has worked in this industry for three years. She buys her merchandise in Santiago or custom orders it from the city of Ligua.

With the support from this loan, Paula plans to purchase vests in various sizes and designs for resale to her customers. Her goal and dream in life is to eventually have her own store, so that she can generate more income and improve her quality of life. She lives with her husband, who is a mine worker. Their three children are in school.

Paula is very happy and grateful for the loan and services provided for her by Fondo Esperanza. She also comments that she has felt very comfortable in the bank meetings, as the people there are generous and unified in their goals. 

Colina is a community in the greater Santiago metropolitan area (where Santiago, the capital city of Chile, is located). Colina is currently an important hub for investments, especially in the agro-industrial sector, since large companies have recently started up operations there and employ a large number of people from the community. It is also an area of subdividing and development, which has led to an increase in the number of inhabitants. Colina has tourist attractions, too, including thermal hot springs, water sports at Laguna Piedra Roja (Red Rock Lagoon), and mountaineering in the mountains nearby.

loans.use: to purchase vests of various sizes and designs for resale to customers.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали- парень 24 лет, женат , имеет одного маленького ребёнка.Жена домохозяйка. Сам Шерали работает разнорабочим на стройках. Но не смотря на это он вместе со своей женой занимается откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него одна дойная корова, которая даёт немного молока, которое хватает семье.Поэтому Шерали хочет купить ещё одну корову, чтоб его жена смогла  продавать и соседям, что будет давать дополнительный доход семье.Шерали доволен сотрудничеству с организацией и благодарен за понимание и финансирование.
texts.en: Sherali is a young 24 year-old guy, married and has one small child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Sherali works as a handyman at construction sites.  Despite this, he and his wife are involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Currently, he has one dairy cow that provides some milk, which is enough for the family.  This is why Sherali wants to buy another cow, so that his wife could sell milk to their neighbors, thus, providing an additional income for the family.  Sherali is happy with the partnership with our organization and is grateful for the understanding and financing.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr: Youssou est un homme marié; il est père de trois enfants dont les deux sont à l'école.Il exerce le métier de chauffeur depuis cinq ans. Il a commencé comme employé par un propriétaires de taxi qui habite dans une grande ville non loin de sa localité. Après quelques années, il a réussi à acheter son propre taxi et à augmenter ainsi ses revenus. Malheureusement , le taxi est tombé en panne de moteur et est resté trois mois sans circuler. C 'est pourquoi, youssou sollicite un pret de 300000f pour compléter son capital et acheter un moteur neuf. Son ambition est d'acheter un autre véhicule.
texts.en: Youssou is a married man and the father of three children - two of whom are in school. He's been a taxi driver for 5 years. He started out as an employee of a taxi company located in the big city close to his town. After a few years, he was able to buy his own taxi and has increased his revenues. Unfortunately, the taxi needs a new motor, and he hasn't been able to drive it for three months. For this reason, Youssou is asking for a loan of 300000f to give him enough money to buy a new motor. His goal is to buy another car.

loans.use: to buy a new motor.

loans.name: Alreda

texts.en: Fifty-five-year-old Alfreda owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like eggs, toiletries, vinegar, soy sauce, and spices. Each month, Alfreda earns 3000 PHP with her business. Alfreda has 3 children, ages 9, 14, and 16. She hopes to earn more and to be able to sustain her children's education. She has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, sugar, and canned goods. With her increased profit, Alfreda will provide her children with a proper education and ensure them bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty  is widowed and has six children.  Only one of her children goes to school. She has a business selling African tunics (bitenge).   She has been in this business for 10 years and sells to all categories of people.  She sells at retail and moves door-to selling bitenge.  She buys these tunics from shops around Kampala city.  She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bales or rolls of these tunics. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include lack of enough market for her tunics, and thieves.  She is hoping to see her business grow so that she can start importing bitenge from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).  She would also like to become a wholesaler and would like to build rental rooms in the available space near her home.  She owns a home and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African Tunics

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 52 years old and married with 5 children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Victoriano primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming. He works hard to keep his farm productive. 

Victoriano has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds. He hopes that, through his loan, his business will improve and his family will also have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She resides in a home that she rents, and the family has access to electricity.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent. 

Margaret sells second-hand clothes and has been in this business for 1 year.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis and works from the market. Margaret works six days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to seeing her business grow big and also to educating her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia Teófila nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la Provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el centro poblado de Yanahuara, ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica de la socia Teófila es la venta e instalación de equipos de medios de comunicación como por ejemplo para internet, para televisión satelital, para celulares y otros más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Teófila requiere el préstamo para comprar celulares.  

La socia Teófila pertenece al banco comunal “San Martin de Yanahuara” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
Teófila was born in the city of Quillabamba in Cusco Department’s La Concepción Province but currently lives in the settlement of Yanahuara.  She’s 54-years-old, married and her beautiful relationship has produced four children.

Teófila’s economic activity is selling communication equipment like for Internet access, satellite TV, mobile phones, and others.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Teófila needs the loan to buy mobile phones.

Teófila belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “San Martín de Yanahuara” communal bank in Cusco Department.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: Miryam con su anterior credikiva Myriam compró un lava cabeza y una silla de peluquería y con ello ha logrado mejorar su mobiliario de peluquería y prestar un mejor servicio a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará un aire acondicionado, una vitrina exhibidora, una mesa de manicure y pedicure, pues pretende mas adelante,  perfeccionar aun mas su servicio, ampliando su espacio de atención, respondiendo a la alta demanda de compradores de su oferta, que últimamente ha solicitado sus diversas líneas. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente. “Señores Kiva: Estoy muy agradecida con ustedes por haberme permitido hacer posible la continuación de mi negocio y la realización de mis sueños. Muchas Gracias”
texts.en:
Miryam used her previous Kiva loan to buy a hair washing sink and a barber’s chair with which she’s improved her beauty salon’s furnishing to provide better customer service.  

She’s now applying for a new Kiva loan to buy an air conditioner, a display case and a table for manicures and pedicures because she intends later on to perfect her service still more expanding the customer service area and responding to the high demand from buyers of her products who have lately been asking for more brands.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Kivans:  I am very grateful to you for having made it possible for me to stay in business and make my dreams a reality.  Many Thanks.”

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, a display case, a manicure and pedicure table.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She grows vegetables and raises pigs. Angelita earns 6000 PHP per month with these activities. She works hard to support her family, which includes her husband and 4 children between the ages of 2 and 7 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase pig feeds, vitamins, and materials to renovate her pig pen. Angelita says she hopes to educate her children and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, vitamins, and materials to renovate her pig pen

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She resides in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Sarah has a cosmetics business. She works on all categories of hair and at times moves door-to-door looking for customers who want their hair to be plaited. In addition to her salon business, she generates additional income by selling used shoes. 

Sarah has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. Her major business challenges include an insufficient market and seasonality.  She aspires to own a fully stocked salon, to educate her children up to the university level, and to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids

loans.name: Turdiboy

texts.ru: Турдыбой-мужчина 31 года, женат имеет двоих детей. Сам Турдыбой работает разнорабочим на стройке, но кроме этого занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у него две коровы,которые откормив он собирается зимой продать за хорошую цену .Но для этого ему необходим корм, для чего он решил получить кредит.А через три месяца планирует получить сумму побольше для увеличения численности коров.За период кредитования от полученной прибыли он смог отремонтировать крышу дома и улучшить семейное положение.
texts.en: Turdiboy is a 31 year-old man, who married and has two children.  He works as a handyman at a construction site, but besides this, is involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Currently, he has two cows that he plans to sell in the winter at a good price after fattening them up.  He needs livestock feed to do this, and this is why he decided to obtain a loan.  He plans to obtain a larger sum in three months in order to increase cattle quantity.  During the financing period, Turdiboy was able to use the resulting profit to repair his house roof and improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and has six children.  All her children go to school.  She has a business of selling local gin.  She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of gin.  She has been in this business for 3 years and sells to all categories of people, but at wholesale only.  Besides this local gin business, she generates additional income through rental rooms.  Her major business challenges include the transportation of jerrycans of local gin from Kasese to her place of work, and thieves.  She is hoping to see her business grow enough profits to build more rental rooms, and also to educate her children up to university.  She lives in her own house and the family does have access to piped water and electricity.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Brown Group

texts.en:
Marry, who is in her early thirties, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a cafe, where she sells soda, juice, water, chapati (unleavened flatbread) and mandazi (fried bread, similar to doughnuts), for one year now. She works from 6:30 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Marry's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her supply of items that were almost out of stock. She paid back her loan successfully. Now, Marry wants a loan to buy more sodas, juice, water, chapati and mandazi. Her dream is to one day own a hotel.

Marry will share this loan with her loan group "Brown" that has a total of thirteen members who will hold each other accountable to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, juice, water, chapati and mandazi.

loans.name: Karen Johana

texts.es:
Doña Karen Johana,  reside en el municipio de Nindirí del departamento de Masaya, casada, tiene la edad de 33 años, comerciante, desde hace 2 años disidió establecer su propio negocio una pulpería con su propios ahorros que ella tenia en ese momento  logró sacar adelante. Su núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposo y su hija pequeña, actualmente  esta necesitando invertirle más a su negocio para la compra de azúcar, arroz faisán, aceite, gaseosas, golosinas, frijoles. Y poder reabastecer su negocio.

Se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un crédito el cual le facilite y ayude a realizar este proyecto y del que también le ayudara a dar una mejor condición de vida tanto a ella como a su familia.
texts.en:
Karen Johana lives in the town of Nindirí in Masaya Department.  She’s 33-years-old, married and a merchant.  Two years ago she decided to start her own business, a grocery store, with her own savings that she had at that time.  She managed to do so.

Her family unit is made up of her husband and little girl.  She currently needs to invest more in the business buying sugar, Faisan brand rice, oil, soft-drinks, snacks and beans to restock her store.

She comes by our offices to request a loan that will help facilitate this project which will also help her provide better living conditions for her and her family

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Jelmar

texts.en: Jelmar is a 23-year-old fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is still single and works to support himself and his family. He is requesting a loan to repair his fishing boat. This will help Jelmar bring in more fish to sell. Jelmar hopes to have a higher daily income so he can continue supporting his family and to save for his future as well.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 33 years old. He is a farmer from Samtredia District, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Zhuzhuna, two daughters (12 and 11 years old), a son (10 years old), and his 71-year-old father, who is a pensioner. Zhuzhuna is a housewife. 

Vazha is mainly busy with the family agricultural business. They have 5 milk cows, 10 sheep, and one pig. Vazha produces cheese and sells an average of 80 kg per month on local open markets. He also sells 10 piglets and 8 lambs in an average year. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Vazha is busy with a family-owned plot of land. He owns 2 hectares where melons and maize are grown. Vazha uses the maize to feed the livestock. He sells melons at the local market as well. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris, including Vazha’s father's pension. 

Vazha has requested a loan to be used for renting a tractor to till the land and for purchasing fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing the plot, Vazha will work hard during the spring and summer seasons. He hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable as well so he will have a good harvest in late summer, which he can sell for a suitable price through his known channels. Vazha will use the additional profit to ensure the well-being of his children and to finance their education.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for tilling the land and to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, tiene la edad 40 de  años, está casada y vive con sus dos hijos y el esposo actualmente. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca de leche. Ella cuenta con varias vacas de leche  a su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio. Ella  quiere tener  sus animales en excelente estado para que puedan dar el máximo de producción y poder vender leche y además hacer queso y natilla para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rita, 40, is married currently living with her husband and two children.  She intends to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.  

She has several dairy cows in her possession and she intends to strengthen the business.  She wants to have her animals in excellent condition so that they will produce the maximum and she can sell the milk as well as make cheese and custard to then sell in the local market and in adjacent locations.  She wants to generate higher profits for her and her family’s wellbeing and to grow with the pig raising project.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered her the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 16 and 20. Her husband works as a carpenter and farmer.

Cecilia used to make roofing materials from dried nipa leaves. Now that she also does farming activities, she buys finished nipa roofing and sells it at a profit. She plans to use her loan to buy more fertilizers for her farm and nipa roofing to sell. Cecilia says, "In the future, I hope to expand our businesses to enable us to have a much bigger profit. I also hope that our skills in managing our businesses will improve."

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Magna

texts.en: Ma. Magna is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children aged between 6 and 18 years. She runs a fishing business with her husband. In addition to selling her husband's catch, she also buys fish from other fishermen and sells them at a profit. Ma. Magna is hoping to have a higher daily income to enable her to sustain her family, especially to support her children's education. She plans to use her loan to repair their fishing boat.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Ysaura Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysaura es una joven d e31 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo y de sus 2 hijos de 14 y tres años, a quienes quiere muchísimo y por ello trabaja muy duro, para darle una vida digna y un futuro  mejor; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que s e caracteriza por su clima cálido sus playas hermosas y sus atractivos turísticos, los cuales son el Candelabro de paracas y las Islas Ballestas, quienes reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta Salir a pasear con sus pequeños sobre todo para distraerse y pasar un tiempo junto; también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Chilcano y el Arroz con Pato. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Contabilidad.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ysaura trabaja en su negocio de venta y compra de chatarra; ella trabaja alrededor de 11 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes de manera diaria, trabaja al lado de su esposo quien la apoya mucho y es su mano derecha; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre está con buen ánimo y los clientes se sienten cómodos con la atención que ella les brinda.

Ysaura está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar la reparación de su pequeña motocarga y comprar más chatarra para vender; de esta manera ella podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado para transportar su mercadería y también tener más productos para ofrecer; así ella seguirá luchando cada  día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio y darle una buena profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Ysaura is a young woman of 31.  She lives together with her husband and her two children who are 14 and 3 years old.  She loves her children dearly and works hard so that she is able to provide them with a decent life and a better future.  Ysaura's home is located in the city of Pisco.  This city is noted for its hot climate, its beautiful beaches, and its tourist spots which include 'el Candelabro' (a prehistoric geoglyph) and the Ballestas Islands.  These places receive a large number of tourists throughout the year.  Whenever she has any time free, Ysaura enjoys going out for walks with her little ones in order to have fun and spend time together.  She also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'chilcano' (a soup made from tuna and seaweed) and duck with rice.  Ysaura only managed to study at high school but she would have liked to have gone on to study accountancy.

Ysaura works, with a lot of enthusiasm, in her business buying and selling recycled materials.  She works around 11 hours a day and can serve up to ten customers.  She works alongside her husband who is a great support and her right-hand man.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is always cheerful and her customers feel comfortable with the service that she provides.

Ysaura is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to repair her small 'motocarga' (motorbike with trailer) and buy more recycled materials to sell.  This will allow her to have a vehicle which is in a good state of repair for transporting her merchandise.  She will also have more products to sell.  She will continue working hard every day in order to fulfill her biggest dream: to own her own premises and ensure her children have a good profession.

loans.use: to repair her 'motocarga' (motorbike with trailer) and to buy recycled materials

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Seven of her children are still school-aged and are under their care. Gonzala works hard to have a higher income and to be able to sustain her family. In addition to her husband's catch, she also buys fish from other fishermen and sells them at a profit.

Gonzala has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and a spotlight for fishing. She hopes to achieve her dream of sending all of her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and a spotlight

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comite de Mujeres Valientes son todas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el grupo tiene 15 integrantes, todas ella son mamas, que luchan driarimamente por dar lo mejor a sus hijos.
Celia es la presidenta y una de las miembros del grupo, ella se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora que no teme a ningún tipo de trabajo, ya que sabe que asi podrá ayudar a su familia. Ella tiene una despensa, con lo cual surte a sus vecinos y tiene los medios necesarios para ayudar a su familia. Su meta es pode seguir ampliando su negocio, y es justamente en vista a ese sueño que siempre se esfuerza.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con artículos de primera necesidad, como ser yerba mate, carnes, fideos, arroz, lácteos y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Mujeres Valientes' committee are all from the city of San Lorenzo.  The group has 15 members who are all moms and who all work every day in order to provide their children with the best in life.

Celia is one of the members of this group and also the group's president.  She describes herself as a very hard-working person who isn't afraid of any type of work because she knows that it will enable her to help her family.  Celia has a grocery store where she provides her neighbors with products.  Her business makes her the income she needs to help her family.  Celia's goal is to be able to continue expanding her business.  It is with this dream in mind that she always works hard.

Celia is requesting a loan to stock her business with basic household products such as yerba mate, meat, noodles, rice, dairy products, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members are receiving.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Tuichi

texts.ru: Туйчи добрый и трудолюбивый семьянин. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием картофеля, а также купле- продажей скота. С детства он занимался откормом скота. Его жена помогает ему по бизнесу, она также имеет опыт в этой сфере деятельности. Помимо того он дополнительно занимается купле- продажей овощей и фруктов. От полученной прибыли Туйчи хочет приобрести автомашину для своего бизнеса. Туйчи запрашивает займ для покупки семян и ядохимикатов для выращивания культур. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Tuichi is a kind and hard-working family man. For over 10 years he has been growing potatoes as well as reselling cattle.  Since his childhood he has been involved in fattening cattle. His wife helps him with his business as she also has experience in that field.  In addition, he also resells fruits and vegetables. Tuichi wants to use the profits to purchase an automobile for his business. Tuichi is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and pesticides for growing crops. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is the leader of the Community Bank called “Soleil Plus” which means “Sun” in English. The group is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Gertrude is 47 years old and a mother of 6 children. She has been active in her business for years. She sells women's shoes. She began her business selling these items. Gertrude joined one of Hope's groups (a D.R. Congo Microfinance Program) in 2010, and has received 7 different loans that she has repaid properly. Thanks to Hope's loans, Gertrude's business has prospered and generates a profit of US$25 per day. 

With her next loan, Gertrude intends to increase the stock of her goods by buying more pairs of women's shoes in bulk and reselling them at a profit, in order to increase her profits. Her ambition is to open a women's shoe shop due to the high demand in her environment. Gertrude works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her goods by buying more pairs of women's shoes in bulk and reselling them at a profit.

loans.name: Presley

texts.es: Presley, tiene la edad 28 de  años, está casada y vive con sus dos hijos y el esposo actualmente. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de semilla de papa para su posterior siembra y además comprar insumos como abonos, herbicidas y foliares. Ella cuenta con un terreno acto para desarrollar dicha actividad y en excelentes condiciones. Ella  quiere tener una excelente producción de papa con la ayuda de los insumos,  para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Presley is 28 years old and married.  She lives with her two children and husband.  Presley plans to use her loan to buy potato seeds to sow.  She will also buy fertilizers, herbicides and 'foliares' (fertilizers that are applied directly to a plant's leaves).  She has a suitable plot of land, which is in excellent condition, on which she will carry out this business.  Presley would like to enjoy an excellent potato production with the help of these supplies.  She will sell her produce in her town market or in neighboring towns.  Presley would like to make as much profit as she can for her own well-being, as well as that of her family.  She would like to grow her business with a pig-fattening project.  

This is the first loan that Presley has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and farming supplies

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 24-year-old married woman. She has a son who is two years old. She describes herself as a focused and determined woman. Alice operates an Agrovet retail store where she sells agrochemicals and animal feed. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Alice describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for expanding the business. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy animal feed to meet customer demand. Her business goal is to run a wholesale retail store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda, candies, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 5 лет он занимается откормом и продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Его место жительства соответствует для развития  животноводства и выращивания сельхозкультур. Имеет достаточно богатый опыт в земледелии. Помимо того он занимается купле- продажей скота. Его заботливая жена помогает мужу по бизнесу. Алишер намерен улучшить свои жилищные условия и хотел бы получить займ для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Алишер надеется на вашу помощь и щедрость.
texts.en: Alisher is a kind and hard-working man.  He is married and is bringing up two children. For over 5 years he has been fattening and reselling cattle as well as growing produce.  His area of residence is suitable for raising cattle and farming. He has a significant experience in agriculture.  In addition, he is reselling cattle. His caring wife helps him in his business. Alisher is planning to improve his living conditions and would like to receive a loan to purchase building materials to repair his house.  Alisher is hoping for your help and generosity.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Joselin Marleni

texts.es:
Joselin es una mujer una mujer muy alegre y sobre todo entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, en este distrito también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de Papa y algodón, también se encuentra algunos Fundos Agrícolas que brindan varios puestos de trabajos a los pobladores de la zona. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y en algunas oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. Con dedicación y sobre todo con el fruto de du trabajo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Joselin trabaja como empleada del hogar, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas, se levanta muy temprano para realizar las labores de su hogar y luego ir a su trabajo, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable, responsable, honrada y se sabe ganar el cariño de su clientes.

Joaselin está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar unos exámenes médicos ya que son muy caros y le son necesarios para poder saber cómo mejorarse; así ella podrá tener  un diagnostico más seguro y poder seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su salud”.
texts.en:
Joselin is a very cheerful and enthusiastic woman.  She lives in Parcona district, Ica, Peru.  Parcona district is noted as having a hot climate.  This district is also known for its agriculture: in particular its potato and cotton growing.  There are a number of large farms in the district that provide jobs to local people.  Whenever she has any free time, Joselin enjoys listening to music.  She also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish).  Joselin is studying hard for a degree in Administration which she is able to do as a result of her work.

Joselin works enthusiastically as a house cleaner.  She works around 8 hours a day.  She gets up very early so that she can do her own housework and then go to work.  She believes that she is doing well in her work because she is kind, responsible, honest and knows how to gain the affection of her customers.

Joselin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to undergo some medical examinations.  These examinations are very expensive and she needs to have them in order to find out how to get better.  She will be able to obtain a reliable diagnosis and continue working in order to fulfill her biggest dream: to improve her health.

loans.use: to undergo some medical examinations

loans.name: Nizomaddin

texts.ru: Низомаддин трудолюбивый и целеустремленный семьянин. Женат, на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» уже 5 раз. Имеет большой опыт в скотоводстве. Жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса, и они вместе дружно работают и стараются улучшить свое благосостоянии семьи. Низомаддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки 5 голов крупного рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Низомаддин трудолюбивый и целеустремленный семьянин. Женат, на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» уже 5 раз. Имеет большой опыт в скотоводстве. Жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса, и они вместе дружно работают и стараются улучшить свое благосостоянии семьи. Низомаддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки 5 голов крупного рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.  

Nizomaddin is a hard-working and goal-oriented family man. He is married and is bringing up 4 children. For over 10 years he has been reselling cattle as well as growing produce. He has taken out a loan from "IMON International" 5 times.  He has a lot of experience in animal husbandry.  His wife helps him in managing his business and they work together on trying to improve the welfare of their family. Nizomaddin would like to receive a loan to purchase 5 heads of cattle for fattening and resale. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед трудолюбивый и честный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Более 6 лет он занимается изготовлением национальной посуды и детских национальных люлек. Он продает свой готовый товар на рынке, а также выезжает на соседний рынок по субботам. Чамшед хотел бы получить займ для покупки древесины (сырья). Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Jamshed is a hard-working and honest man.  He is married and is bringing up 6 children.  For over 6 years he has been manufacturing national dishes and children's national cradles.  He sells his finished goods at a market as well as a neighboring market on Saturdays. Jamshed would like to receive a loan to purchase wood (raw material). He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 33 years old. She is a married woman and has three children. Their ages are six, seven and ten. She runs a sari-sari store that earns her 3,000 PHP each month. She sells snack foods, toiletries, and canned goods. Maylinda works hard to provide for her family's basic needs and to send her children to school. She has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices, and noodles. This will help increase Maylinda's sales and profitability.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices, and noodles

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Babacar est un homme marié et père de trois enfants.Deux de ses enfants vont à l'école.Il exerce un commerce de produits agricole. Ainsi, il tient une boutique dans laquelle il propose à ses clients de l'arachide, du mil, des haricots.afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des sacs de mil et d'arachide.
texts.en: Babacar is married and a father to three children, two of whom go to school. He has a boutique where he sells agricultural products such as peanuts, millet, and beans. In order to grow his business, he is asking for a loan for 200000f to buy bags of millet and peanuts.

loans.use: to buy bags of millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Mpore Group

texts.fr:
Denise fait partie du groupe Mpore et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 47 ans .Elle a 4 enfants âgés  de 13  à 26 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz,…).

Elle est à son quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de boutique (haricot, riz,…).

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait chercher le raccordement de l’eau et d’électricité de sa maison.
texts.en:
Denise is a member of the Mpore group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 47 year old widow. She has 4 children between the ages of 13 and 26. One of her children goes to school.

She is a shopkeeper (beans, rice, etc.), and this is her 15th loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large amount inventory for her shop (beans, rice, etc.).

In the next few years, she would like to install water and electric hookups in her house.

loans.use: will increase her capital and buy a large amount of inventory for her shop (beans, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 40-year-old married man. His wife is a businesswoman. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be a visionary, aggressive, and determined man. He operates a retail store where he provides artistic services for designing maps, roads, houses, etc. He has been involved in this business for 13 years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a busy market, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy stationery and drawing tools. His business goal is to increase the size of his clients within five years. Benson plans to increase job opportunities for people by becoming an international artist.

loans.use: To buy stationery and drawing tools for drawing maps, houses, roads and dams

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en: Procesa is a 62-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is in the business of raising hogs. She earns 4,000 PHP each month, which enables her to help provide for her family's basic needs. Procesa hopes to have a higher income, so she can improve her family's living conditions. She has requested a loan to purchase additional piglets and feed. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her profitability.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Meivy

texts.es: Meivy  de 47 años vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 21 años en el Municipio de Soledad, donde se dedica a la venta de bebidas frías y de mercancía a crédito y por encargo. Su negocio inició desde el año 2002, cuando mediante la observación identificó un nicho de mercado en el cual ingresar para genera ingresos; fue así como detectando que los negocios cercanos a su vivienda,  se quedaban sin cervezas los fines de semana, porque solamente llegaban los distribuidores dos veces por semana, decidió tener ella lo que esos negocios necesitaban. Inicialmente empezó con dos canastas de cervezas, para hacer pruebas en su mercado, como tuvo una gran acogida, se interesó en hacer inversión en este negocio y hoy es uno de los generadores de ingresos mas importantes que tiene,  junto a su distribución de mercancía al detalle, que es una alternativa de ingresos, mediante la cual aprovechar a su clientela cautiva. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responderle a su creciente clientela y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara cajas de cervezas para aumentar su potencial de ventas y también se prepara  con mercancía variada, para responder a las temporadas de mayor movimiento comercial, como los días familiares y religiosos, como ropa, fantasía, las cuales otorga a sus clientes,  mediante créditos que le pagan a 60 días o en un plazo no mayor que este. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos y por eso todos los días trabaja con esmero, para alcanzarla
texts.en:
Meivy, age 47, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 19 and 21.  She lives in the Soledad municipality, which is where she sells cold drinks. She also sells merchandise on credit and by order. 

She started her business in 2002, when she found her niche in the market so that she could generate income.  She discovered that the businesses close to her home did not have beer on the week-ends because the distributers only came two times a week.  She decided to have what these businesses needed.

She initially started with two baskets of beer in order to test the market.  As she was very well-received, she was interested in investing in this business.  Now, it is one of the most important income generators that she has.  She couples this with her retail distribution of merchandise, an alternative income through which she takes advantage of her captive clientele.

She currently does not have enough working capital to respond to her growing clientele.  That is exactly the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy cases of beer in order to increase her potential sales.  She will also be prepared with varied merchandise in order to respond to the seasons when there is the greatest commercial movement like family and religious holidays. She will buy clothes and lingerie to give her customers on credit, which is to be paid in a time period of no greater than 60 days.

Her goal for later on is to expand her business in order to get greater income.  She works hard every day to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy drinks by the case and to buy varied clothing for women and lingerie.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou est un commerçant qui vend des produits alimentaires au marché central de sa localité.Il est marié et père de trois enfants.Il loge avec sa famille en location.Pour améliorer les conditions d'habitat, il a démarré la construction de sa maison depuis près d'un an. Afin  de confectionner des portes et des fenêtres, il sollicite un pret de 150000f.
texts.en: Abdou is a shopkeeper who sells foodstuffs in the central market of his town. He is married and has three children. He lives with his family in rental housing. To improve his living situation, he began construction on a home almost a year ago. He's requesting a loan for 150,000f in order to make doors and windows for his home.

loans.use: make doors and windows.

loans.name: Kenia Yuritza

texts.es:
Kenia Yuritza, reside  en el departamento de Masaya, madre soltera, tiene la edad de 26 años, comerciante tiene su propio negocio, el cual  consiste en la elaboración de tortillas hechas a base de maíz, posee su negocio desde hace 8 años, ella misma se encarga de elaborarlas y de venderlas en su casa de habitación, ahí tiene concentrada su propia clientela la cual es fija. Comenta que ella a raíz de que no pudo conseguir un trabajo estable, tomo la decisión de emprender su propio negocio, ya que es la que tiene que trabajar para poder mantener a su única hija. 

Esta necesitando invertirle más a su negocio ya que la temporada en estos meses es buena, por lo que se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un financiamiento que le permita realizar su propósito. Y del cual le dará una mejor atención a su clientela y mayor satisfacción a la demanda obtenida.
texts.en:
Kenia Yuritza is a 26-year-old single mother who lives in the department of Masaya.  She is a merchant who has her own corn tortilla-making business, which she has had for 8 years.  She makes the tortillas and also sells them from her home.  She focuses on pleasing her regular customers.  She says that she decided to start her own business because she couldn’t get a steady job, and she needed to earn money to support her daughter.  

Kenia needs to invest more in her business, since this time of year is good for sales.  That is the reason she has come to the CEPRODEL office: to ask for a loan so she can invest in supplies for her business.  The loan will make it possible for her to provide her customers with better service and better satisfy demand.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood, corn, lime, and a griddle for making tortillas.

loans.name: Evageline

texts.en:
Evageline is a single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 23 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be courageous, a go-getter, and focused. She operates rental houses where she provides housing accomodation. She has been in this business for 30 years. Her business is located within a strategically placed town. 

Also, Evageline does farming where she sells vegetables to increase her income in order to support her family, as she is the sole provider. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a delay of payments from the tenants. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the houses. This is the second loan she is requesting. The first one was in the amount of KES 100,000, which she managed to pay well.  Her business goal is to construct more rental houses for increasing accommodation for her customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will construct a full home compound for her family.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of the rental houses

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia tiene 36 años, está casada con el Sr. Victor con quien tiene dos hijos mayores y una menor. Ella trabajaba en una casa de familia, hasta que logró tener su despensa en su casa; mientras que don Victor trabaja en una empresa envasadora de alimentos.
Doña Cecilia trabaja en su despensa desde el año 2009, y ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella. 
Hoy, doña Cecilia ya también está vendiendo helados, bebidas y numerosos productos para el hogar, así como también minutas.
 La Sra Cecilia necesita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir para niños, para damas y caballeros, pues  le va muy bien en sus ventas y desea ampliar el stock de productos ofrecidos dentro de su despensa. Su anhelo es poder concluir la construcción de su modesta vivienda y así como también poder solventar hasta el final los estudios de su hija menor.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 36 years old, and is married to Victor, who works at a food packaging plant. Together they have two grown sons and one young daughter. Cecilia worked as a maid in the home of a family until she was able to start a business out of her home. She started her own business in 2009, and she already has a large base of customers who purchase products regularly from her.

She presently sells ice cream, drinks, traditional food items and many other products. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase women's, men's and children's clothing, since clothing sales are going well for her and she wants to increase the variety of products she offers to customers. Her dream is to finish construction on their home and enable her daughter to complete her education.

loans.use: to puchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Power Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children who go to school.  She has been selling Irish potatoes at a wholesale price for four years.  She works from 8.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more Irish potatoes, curtains, floor tiles and bricks.  She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She wants a loan to open a grocery.  Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

She will share her loan with her group, Power, which has a total of 16 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To open a grocery

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en: Arsenio is a 63-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He buys bananas, cassava, and yams that he resells at the market. He works hard to increase his income and be able to provide for his family's basic needs. He applied for a loan to buy more bananas, cassava, and yams to sell. He hopes to have a stable business and a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, and yams to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He supports his family through his fishing, which earns him about 7,000 PHP per month. Samuel works hard to increase his income and keep up with the increasing needs in their household. 

He requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and gasoline. He hopes to acquire an additional fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and gasoline.

loans.name: Yasmith

texts.es: Yasmith de 23 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 años y 9 meses;  allí tiene una miscelánea donde vende detalles para el hogar, fantasías, adornos, artículos escolares y jeans. Su negocio lo inició, por iniciativa de su cónyuge, quien trabaja en una empresa que produce línea de ropa deportiva y por eso le propuso vender estas mercancías, para lograr mayores ingresos adicionalmente. Con su negocio a Yasmith le ha ido muy bien y actualmente cuenta con clientes fijos, que le encargan para la venta y como también vende blusas, tiene un mercado que ya la conoce. Su ideal es tener un punto comercial propio, donde exhibir su mercancía y convertirse en distribuidora importante de muchos vendedores al detalle, por eso al iniciar el presenta año, cuando la propietaria de un local le ofreció alquilarle a un buen precio, pues ella se mudaría de la ciudad, a Yasmith le pareció interesante la oferta y la aprovechó, dando lugar a la miscelánea que hoy tiene y desea hacer crecer, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará útiles escolares, adornos, detalles variados y ropa en general. Su inversión tendrá éxito, porque esta ubicada en un punto comercial de gran concurrencia de transeúntes y porque aprovechará la demanda de mercancía que usualmente se presenta en el mes de Mayo y Junio, con motivo de la celebración de fiestas familiares y religiosas.
texts.en:
Yasmith is 23 years old and lives in the town of Soledad.  She lives with her husband and her two children who are 5 years and 9 months old respectively.  Yasmith has a general store where she sells gifts for the home, costume jewelry, decorations, school supplies and jeans. She started her business on the suggestion of her husband who works for a company that produces sports clothing.  He suggested that she sell this merchandise in order to make additional income.  Yasmith has done very well in her business and she has regular customers who order items from her.  She also sells blouses and has an existing market for her products.  Her dream is to have her own commercial premises where she can display her merchandise and to become an important wholesaler, providing products to retailers.  

At the beginning of this year, when the owner of some business premises offered to rent them to her at a good price because she was moving away from the city, Yasmith became interested in the offer and took advantage of it.  This is where her general store is now located and she would like to grow her business.  However, she does not have enough working capital.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (the first loan she has taken out from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use the loan to buy school supplies, decorations, gifts and clothing.  Her investment will be successful because her business is located in a commercial area that is very busy with passersby.  She will also make the most of the demand for merchandise which she generally experiences in May and June, as a result of the family and religious celebrations that take place during those months.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, decorations, gifts and clothing

loans.name: Prospérité Plus Group

texts.en:
Guy is the chairman of the community bank, Prospérité Plus, which is composed of 20 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Guy runs a telephone booth west of Kinshasa and is a money changer. He began his business in 2009. His beginning capital was US $100. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Guy is now well-known and liked in this area because of his prospering business. He is a trustworthy client who has received four HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. He makes US $120 in profit each week. Guy intends with the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards to meet his customers' demands and generate additional profits. He is 38 years old, married, and a father of two children (ages two and four), and one of them goes to school. His ambition is to become a prepaid card provider in his area.

loans.use: To buy more prepaid cards to meet customers' demands and generate additional profits

loans.name: Oracle Plus Group

texts.en:
Ben is the leader of the Community Bank, “Oracle Plus”. The group is composed of thirteen members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Ben makes his living by selling home appliances at the market. He began his business in 1997. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Ben is now well-known and liked through his business. He is a trustworthy client who received three times the MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes about US $120 of profit each week. 

Ben intends to use the next loan to purchase more home appliances in bulk to meet the customer demand and generate additional profits. He is 33 years old, married, and a father of three children, aged between 6 months and 8 years old, of whom two go to school. His ambition is to open a general store in his area.

loans.use: to buy more home appliances in bulk to meet the customer demand and generate additional profits.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita runs a fishing business with her husband in Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 30 years old and has four children aged between 4 and 11 years.

Benita's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. She sells his catch at the market and also buys more fish from other fishermen. Benita does her best to improve their earnings and keep her family healthy. She has applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets and other materials. This will help Benita and her husband bring in more fish to sell. Benita will also be able to pay for school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is an Avon dealer. She earns 3,000 PHP per month selling Avon products to her community. Alejandra does her best to support her husband in providing for their family's needs. She also wants her children to be able to go to college.

Alejandra is requesting a loan to buy more Avon products to sell. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman in the future. She also hopes for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 29-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be an aggressive and focused woman. 

She operates a boutique where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. Rosemary also runs a chemist business where she sells medicine to patients to increase her income. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to improve her boutique business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Doriccus

texts.en: Doriccus is a 36-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be an aggressive, determined, and visionary woman. She runs a restaurant and grocery store with her husband where they sell snacks, food, and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located near a quarry, and her primary customers are village dwellers and masons. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy bundles of flour, oil, and green vegetables. This is the second loan Doriccus has requested from SMEP DTM. Her first loan was in the amount of KES 20,000, which she managed to pay well. Her business goal is to run a bigger hotel. She hopes that in the future, she will use the profits generated for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy bundles of flour, oil, and green vegetables

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en: Marnie is 21 years old. She is a married woman and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Marnie supports her husband by selling his catch at the market. She also grows seaweed to sell. Marnie works hard to supplement the family's income and provide for their household needs. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. Marnie hopes to acquire another fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette is 36 years old and is a married woman with three children, aged 6, 8 and 10. Her husband works as a security guard.

Antonette sells green barley products (a food supplement) to her community. She became a dealer six months ago. Antonette does her best to help supplement the family income. She has applied for a loan to buy more green barley products to sell. Antonette hopes to succeed in her business venture.

loans.use: to buy more green barley products to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 29 years old and is a married man with three children, aged 8 months, 6 years and 8 years. He has a habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) business in San Miguel, Bohol. He earns about 9,000 PHP per month with his business. Allan works hard to increase his income and keep up with the increasing needs in his household. He has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 2, 6 and 11. 

Annalie cultivates her land to grow rice crops. Her harvest goes to family consumption and for selling. She needs additional capital to fund her farm. 

She plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor. Annalie hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.es: José Lino, tiene la edad  de 32 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa dos hijos y con su madre y dos hermanos actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra y además comprar el almacigo de café. El tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos y  el almacigo de café para su posterior siembra y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Lino is 32 years old, married, lives with her wife, two sons, his mother and two brothers. 

With the loan, he wants to pay for the agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and sprays and the labor and also to buy the coffee plants. He has thought that he will buy all these agricultural inputs and the seedling of coffee for his next coffee planting. With this, he hopes to make better profits, obtain a better quality of life and economic stability. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has had other loans from the government banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better characteristics and much lower rates.

loans.use: to pay for the agricultural inputs and buy the coffee plants

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en: Bebiana is a food vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She makes banana cue and fried peanuts that she sells to her community. She works hard to support her family of a husband and seven children. Bebiana has requested a loan to buy more peanuts and bananas. She hopes to have a stable business in the future. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and bananas

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio is 45 years old and is a married man with five children aged between 9 and 20 years. He is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He grows and sells rice to his community. Eugenio's family depends on his farming. He works hard to keep his farm productive and increase his earnings. He has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor. Eugenio hopes to have sufficient capital to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Bilquis Begum's Group

texts.en:
Bilquis Begum is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of four sons. Her eldest son has a nan (bread) stall business. He sells a variety of nan breads (potato & gram flour) to the customers and charges different prices. He makes good sales from his business and earns good profits. His father also runs a food stall where he sells dahi bhalay (very popular Punjabi dish made with potatoes, yogurt and spicy & sweet sauces) to his customers. He also makes good sales from his business.  

Bilquis herself is a very talented lady. She operates a sewing business to supplement the income of her family. Her work is home-based. She sews clothes for her neighboring customers. Besides her sewing business, she also does the household works with much dedication. Her family is very happy with her loving and caring nature. 

Bilquis has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy flour, cooking oil, spices, potatoes and gram flour in larger quantity to meet the client’s order on time and increase the income. 
She is very confident about the future growth of her son’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy required material for nan (bread) stall business

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Дети еще маленькие старшему 3-года, младшему 2 годика. На протяжении 2-х лет она занимается купле- продажей бытовой техники. В 2009 году он продал свой собственный автомобиль за 4000 долларов США и начал свой бизнес. Его бизнес является прибыльным, среди населения города много потребностей на телевизоры, параболические антенны и другие виды техники. В бизнесе помогает его отец. Зоир хотел бы получить займ для покупки бытовой техники с целью пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Zoir is a kind and hard-working person. He is married and bringing up two children. His children are still very young: the eldest is three years old, and the youngest is just two. For two years, [Zoir] has been buying and reselling  consumer electronics. In 2009, he sold his   personal car for 4,000 USD and launched his business. His business is profitable, as there is a lot of local demand for TVsets, dish antennas and other kinds of electronics. His father helps him in his business. Zoir would like to obtain a loan to buy home electronics in order to bolster his working capital.

loans.use: to buy home electronics, replenishing his working capital.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Sam N° 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Takku liggey sam n°4" est constitué de cinq femmes.
