Elles habitent le même quartier et exercent un commerce de tissus, de sacs, de produits cosmétiques et de mercerie.Elles achètent les produits en gros et chacun prend sa part en fonction de son apport dans le capital de départ.Le chef du groupe ( main levée) est mère de trois enfants. Elle vend ses produits dans une cantine implantée devant son domicile.Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de ses enfants.
Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour
texts.en:
The "Takku liggey sam n°4" group is comprised of five women. They live in the same neighborhood and have a business selling fabric, bags, cosmetics, and dry goods. They buy their products wholesale and each woman contributes to the startup capital. 

The head of the group (hand raised)  is the mother of three children. She sells her products in a small shop in front of her home. Her business brings in revenue which allows her to meet her needs as well as the needs of her family.

In order to grow their business, they are asking for a loan of 250000f.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gie Ugpr 1 Takku Liggey Sam Group

texts.fr: L'UGPR 1 Takku Liguey SAM  est un groupe de solidarité qui regroupe cinq femmes, toutes mariées. Elles s'activent dans un commerce de produits alimentaires et de vêtements.Elles achètent en gros pour amoindrir les prix de revient et se partagent les produits en fonction de l'apport de chacune d'elle. Elles parviennent avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce à prendre ne charge leurs propres besoins et à participer aux dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 250 000f pour acheter du mil, de la patte d'arachide, de l'huile ainsi que d'autres produits divers. Elles ambitionnent d'acheter des cantines au grand marché de leur localité.
texts.en: The UGRP 1 Takku Liguey Sam solidarity group is composed of five women, all married. They sell food items and clothing. They buy wholesale in order to drive the prices down and divide the products according to each member’s contribution. Thanks to the revenues from their business, they are able to provide for their personal needs and contribute to the budget of their respective households. In order to bolster their working capital, they are seeking a loan of 250,000 West African francs in order to buy millet, peanut paste, vegetable oil and various other products. Their goal is to buy food stands at the big market in their village. .

loans.use: to buy millet, peanut paste, vegetable oil and various other products.

loans.name: Eutemia

texts.en: Eutemia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store, where she sells items such as snack foods, canned goods, sugar, and toiletries. Each month, Eutemia earns 5000 PHP from her business. She finds it difficult to replenish her inventory rapidly because her income is used for her family's daily consumption. She requested this loan to buy more merchandise, such as soft drinks and rice. Eutemia hopes for increased sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell (such as softdrinks and rice)

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is a 41-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He works hard to increase his daily income because his family depends on him. Hilario requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help him bring in more fish to sell. Hilario hopes to have a successful fishing business. He also hopes to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: 41-year-old Flordeliza lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol, with her family. She is married with seven children between the ages of 2 and 22. Flordeliza and her husband are both farmers. They cultivate their land to grow rice crops. Their harvest is used for family consumption and sold. Flordeliza does her best to manage their farm and take care of her children. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. Flordeliza hopes to have an additional source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Isabelito

texts.en: Isabelito is 51 years old and a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He buys coconut shells that he resells at a profit. His regular customers buy his coconut shells to make charcoal. Isabelito earns 4,000 PHP per month with his business. He has requested a loan to buy more coconut shells to sell. In the future, Isabelito hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Liduena

texts.en:
Liduena is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Liduena's husband is also a farmer. They both work hard to sustain their family. 

Liduena requested a loan to fund their farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. Liduena is happy to be able to help some laborers in their town that they hire to help till their land. She hopes to have a successful harvest soon.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alirio De Jesus

texts.es: Alirio de 54 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde se dedica a muchas actividades productivas: por un lado distribuye productos de panadería, vende gallina y cerdo, así como también comercializa productos de dulcería. Sus tradiciones culturales provienen del Valle del Cauca, lugar de donde es oriundo y  de allí llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 15 años. Alirio terminó su bachillerato y empezó a estudiar aviación, pero solo lo hizo durante 1 año, porque los ingresos familiares no se lo permitieron, por eso se dedicó gran parte de su vida a la crianza de pequeñas especies y al cultivo de la tierra. En Barranquilla actualmente, ha logrado posicionarse en el comercio y distribución de productos alimenticios de panadería y dulcería y en su propia motocicleta reparte de tienda en tienda, todos los días, galletas, brazos de reina y productos derivados de la harina de trigo, mientras los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de cerdo y gallina criolla a la que últimamente ha agregado pescado. Su meta mas adelante es tener una empresa piscicultura y con ello lograr adquirir su propia casa. Mientras sus sueños se cumplen mediante su trabajo, maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 9 días, una rotación de inventario de 2 días y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de los 30%, indicadores desde los cuales proyectamos una exitosa inversión de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de panadería y dulcería, en cuanto a que su mercado está creciendo y  la demanda de productos cada día es mayor, lo cual hace que su capital de trabajo se torne insuficiente para lograr atenderla y esto es justamente lo que solucionará su credikiva.
texts.en:
Alirio is 54 years old and lives in the southwestern portion of the city, where he performs many productive activities. On one hand, he distributes bakery products, sells hens and pigs, and he also sells candy. His cultural traditions are those of the Cauca Valley where he comes from. And from there, he arrived in the city of Barranquilla 15 years ago. Alirio graduated from secondary school and began studying aviation, but only for 1 year, since his family's income would not permit more. For that reason, he has dedicated the greater part of his life to raising small farm animals and cultivating the earth.

In Barranquilla at present, he has succeeded in establishing himself in commerce and food distribution, including baked goods and candy. He distributes these, store to store, on his own motorcycle everyday -- cookies, Swiss rolls, and other products derived from wheat flour -- while on weekends, he sells pigs and 'criolla' hens, and has lately added fish.

Alirio's distant goal is to have a fish-raising enterprise and then, to acquire his own house. Meanwhile, his dreams are fulfilled through his own work. He has obtained a rotation of customer accounts each 9 days, an inventory rotation of 2 days, and a profitability over sales of no less than 30%, indicators that promise a successful investment of his Kiva loan, his first financing with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. 

Alirio will buy bakery and candy products for his expanding market, where demand is growing daily. His working capital is insufficient to restock his business and this is precisely what his Kiva loan will do.

loans.use: to buy bakery and candy products for his growing market.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works as a driver.

Lucille is a vegetable farmer. Specifically, she grows squash, eggplants, tomatoes, and pechay. She does her best to keep her produce healthy and of good quality. She needs more seeds and fertilizers, which is why she requested this loan. In the future, Lucille hopes to own more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 8 to 14 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals, such as maize, millet, etc. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize. This is the first loan she is requesting. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of cereals within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more maize for selling

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 51-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She sells pancakes, rice cakes and other local delicacies. She earns 4500 PHP per month with this business. Lorna's husband is a farmer and she helps him keep their farm free of weeds and pests. She also helps in selling their harvest to the community.

Lorna is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil. She hopes this loan will help increase her profitability. She said she wants to be able to help send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is an Avon dealer living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is 28 years old and married, with two children ages five and seven. She earns 2,000 PHP per month selling Avon products to her community, and she also grows vegetables that she sells at the market. 

Mirasol plans to use her loan to buy more Avon products to sell. She hopes her income will increase so she can save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a food vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 50 years old and married with six children, four of whom still attend school. Prima's husband is a farmer.

Prima sells rice cakes, pancakes, and bread to her community. She earns 3,500 PHP per month. Prima works hard to increase her income and support her family financially. She requested a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, yeast, and cooking oil. Prima hopes for her business to grow and for her family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico, a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol, is 32 and married with two children. He cultivates his land to plant rice crops and sells the harvest to his community. 

Rico needs funding for his farm. He plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor. Rico hopes to own a bigger farm in the future and to help more laborers in his town.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 33 years old and a married woman with five children between five and 12 years old. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol, and she primarily grows rice crops to sell. Rosie's goals are to send her children to college and improve her family's living condition.

Rosie is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. Rosie hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes that, through her business, she will be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 53 years old and a married woman with ten children, three of whom are school-aged. Valentina and her husband are both farmers, and they work together cultivating their land and planting rice crops. Valentina does her best to improve their business and keep her family in good health. 

Valentina applied for a loan to help fund her farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. She hopes this loan will help keep the farm productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.
